"My Wife Loves Staring At Me": Adar Poonawalla Mocks L&T Chief's Remark - NDTV
summary:
"My Wife Loves Staring At Me": Adar Poonawalla Mocks L&T Chief's Remark

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: NDTV

Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla comments on work-life balance, supporting the sentiment that quality of work is more important than quantity, in response to controversial remarks from L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan.

  • Poonawalla emphasizes quality over quantity in work hours on social media.
  • His comment follows Mahindra's remarks about work output versus hours logged.
  • Subrahmanyan suggests employees should work 90 hours a week, sparking backlash.
  • Critics, including Jwala Gutta and Harsh Goenka, label Subrahmanyan's comments as harmful and unrealistic.
  • The debate around work-life balance highlights differing perspectives among industry leaders.

"Why shouldn't he stare at his wife... and why only on a Sunday?" - Jwala Gutta

The ongoing discussion illustrates the tensions between work expectations and personal life, emphasizing the importance of sustainable work practices.
newTitle: "My Wife Loves Staring At Me": Adar Poonawalla Mocks L&T Chief's Remark

title: Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you're unwell during sick leaves | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Companies Hire Detectives to Monitor Sick Leave Amid 90-Hour Workweek Debate

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Agence France-Presse

As sick leave practices come under scrutiny in Germany, companies are hiring detectives to confirm employee illnesses. This trend reflects concerns about high absenteeism rates during a national economic slump.

  • Growing number of companies checking employee sick leave legitimacy.
  • High absenteeism rates have led to economic concerns in Germany.
  • Calls for a 90-hour workweek by business leaders in India spark debate.
  • Data shows Germans missed an average of 6.8% of working hours due to illness in 2023.
“If someone has 30, 40 or sometimes up to 100 sick days in a year, then at some point they become economically unattractive for the employer.” - Marcus Lentz

This increasing scrutiny of sick leave highlights the lengths companies will go to manage absenteeism and the tensions between employee welfare and business interests.
newTitle: Companies Hire Detectives to Monitor Sick Leave Amid 90-Hour Workweek Debate

This ongoing market trend highlights ongoing investor concerns, primarily due to economic forecasts and global financial pressures.

summary:
Market cap of five of top-10 most-valued firms tumbles ₹1.85 lakh crore; HDFC Bank hit hard

Date: Not specified

Source: Live Mint

The combined market capitalization of five of the top-10 most-valued companies decreased significantly last week, primarily impacting HDFC Bank, amidst a downturn in the stock market.

This article highlights the major market fluctuations affecting leading companies, specifically noting HDFC Bank's notable losses in market capitalization.

  • The combined market cap of five top companies fell by ₹1,85,952.31 crore.
  • HDFC Bank suffered the largest drop in valuation, losing ₹70,479.23 crore.
  • The BSE Sensex fell by 1,844.2 points (2.32%).
  • Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) and others gained, countering the trend.
“HDFC Bank's valuation declined by ₹70,479.23 crore, settling at ₹12,67,440.61 crore.”

The significant decline in market capitalization reflects broader market trends and impacts on investor sentiment.
newTitle: Major Market Cap Decline for Top Firms; HDFC Bank Struggles

Will stock market selloff deepen this week? 6 factors to track - The Economic Times
summary:
Will Stock Market Selloff Deepen This Week? 6 Factors to Track

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Economic Times

Amid hawkish commentaries from Fed members on interest rate outlook and other economic factors, the Nifty ended around 2.4% last week, reflecting market volatility.

  • Q3 Earnings: Major companies like Reliance, Infosys, and HCL Tech are set to report quarterly results.
  • FII Flow: Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) were net sellers, offloading Rs 16,854 crore.
  • Dollar Effect: The Indian rupee slipped to its all-time low at 85.9650, down 0.2% on the week.
  • Macro Data: India's inflation rate and industrial production figures will influence market direction.
  • Crude Oil: Oil prices increased due to sanctions on Russian oil, with Brent crude futures settling at $79.76 a barrel.
  • Technical Factor: Nifty trading below its 21-week and daily EMA suggests a bearish tone in the market.
“Nifty has been falling since encountering resistance... The bearish sentiment appears to be intensifying,” said Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst.

The stock market remains under pressure, and various economic indicators will play a crucial role in determining its direction in the coming week.
newTitle: Will Stock Market Selloff Deepen This Week? 6 Factors to Track

title: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg angry, says that Apple is making them pay for “failing iPhone sales” by - The Times of India
summary:
Mark Zuckerberg Criticizes Apple Over iPhone Sales Impact

Publication Date: Not Provided Source: Not Provided

Mark Zuckerberg has expressed his anger regarding Apple, asserting that the company is forcing Facebook to bear the financial burden caused by declining iPhone sales.

  • Zuckerberg claims Apple is leveraging its dominant position to impose costs on Facebook.
  • He believes this strategy negatively impacts innovation and competition within the tech industry.
  • The criticism comes amid a backdrop of increasing tensions between major tech companies.
“Apple is making us pay for their failures,” Zuckerberg stated during a recent conference.

This statement showcases the growing rivalry and concerns about market dynamics among technology giants.
newTitle: Mark Zuckerberg Criticizes Apple Over iPhone Sales Impact

summary:
Dividend Stocks: TCS, PCBL, CESC to Trade Ex-Dividend Next Week

Publication Date: Next week

Source: BSE

Major companies like Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), PCBL, and CESC will trade ex-dividend next week, indicating the stock price will not include the value of the upcoming dividend.

Stocks Declaring Dividends

  • CESC Ltd: Interim dividend of ₹4.5 on January 16, 2024.
  • PCBL Ltd: Interim dividend of ₹5.5 on January 16, 2024.
  • Tata Consultancy Services Ltd: Interim dividend of ₹10 and special dividend of ₹36 on January 17, 2024.
  • Vantage Knowledge Academy Ltd: Interim dividend of ₹0.1 on January 17, 2024.

Stocks Declaring Stock Splits

  • Shardul Securities Ltd: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹2 on January 13, 2024.
  • Regis Industries Ltd: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹1 on January 16, 2024.
  • Arunjyoti Bio Ventures Ltd: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹1 on January 17, 2024.
  • Jai Balaji Industries Ltd: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹2 on January 17, 2024.

Bonus Issues

  • Kitex Garments Ltd: Bonus issue in the ratio of 2:1 on January 17, 2024.
  • Sattva Sukun Lifecare Ltd: Bonus issue in the ratio of 3:5 on January 17, 2024.

Other Corporate Actions: Various companies will announce right issues and income distribution throughout next week.

This week sees significant corporate actions, affecting numerous shareholders and indicating a busy financial climate.
newTitle: Dividend Stocks: TCS, PCBL, CESC to Trade Ex-Dividend Next Week

Ranking and citation rat race is hurting India’s academic reputation - The Times of India
summary:
Ranking and Citation Rat Race Hurting India's Academic Reputation

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

This article discusses how the increasing focus on academic rankings and citations is negatively impacting India's reputation in the global academic community. It highlights the pressures that this rat race creates for researchers and institutions.

  • The emphasis on rankings is leading to a culture of superficiality in research.
  • Many researchers prioritize quantity over quality in publications.
  • This trend could jeopardize the integrity of academic work in India.
  • There is a call for a more balanced approach to academic evaluation.
"The relentless pursuit of rankings can compromise the true mission of academia - the pursuit of knowledge."

In conclusion, while academic metrics are important, the article advocates for a shift towards valuing quality and impact over mere numbers in ranking systems.
newTitle: Ranking and Citation Rat Race Hurting India's Academic Reputation

title: Amazon Axes Diversity Initiatives Before Trump's Return, Meta Orders Tampon Removal From Men's Bathrooms - News18
summary:
Amazon Axes Diversity Initiatives Before Trump's Return, Meta Orders Tampon Removal From Men's Bathrooms

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: News18

Ahead of Donald Trump’s return as US President, Amazon and Meta have announced significant cutbacks to their diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives amidst rising conservative pushback.

  • Amazon plans to phase out outdated diversity programmes by the end of 2024 as part of a broader shift influenced by recent conservative critiques and legal challenges.
  • Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg has ordered the removal of tampons from men's bathrooms and closed their DEI programmes.
  • Both companies are responding to a changing legal landscape and pressure from conservative groups following recent Supreme Court rulings.
  • Notably, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has financially supported Trump’s inaugural committee.
“The legal and policy landscape surrounding diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts in the United States is changing.” - Janelle Gale, Meta’s Vice President of Human Resources

The actions taken by Amazon and Meta mark a significant shift in corporate diversity strategies amid a politically charged atmosphere in the U.S.
newTitle: Amazon and Meta Scale Back Diversity Initiatives Ahead of Trump's Return
